articles.title: ‘Hockey’ and ‘World Cup’ references top Kalshi odds on Trump’s State of the Union address
articles.summary: Kalshi bettors are wagering that Trump will reference "hockey" and "World Cup" during his upcoming State of the Union address, with these oddly specific topics topping the platform's speech prediction odds. The market reveals how traders hunt for insider information or leaked speech drafts, turning presidential rhetoric into profitable arbitrage opportunities for those with early access to talking points.

articles.title: From niche to $3 billion run rate: prediction markets eye $10 billion future, Citizens says
articles.summary: Citizens projects prediction markets will hit a $10 billion valuation after reaching a $3 billion annual run rate, marking the sector's rapid evolution from experimental curiosity to mainstream financial instrument. The forecast signals institutional acceptance is accelerating, which means more liquidity, tighter spreads, and legitimate competition for traditional polling and forecasting methods.

articles.title: States are fighting back against online prediction markets
articles.summary: State regulators are cracking down on online prediction markets, likely targeting platforms that operate without proper licensing or exceed legal boundaries. This regulatory pushback could force major platforms to restrict access in certain states or face costly compliance battles that reshape how Americans bet on politics and current events.

articles.title: Senate Democrats press CFTC chair on prediction markets
articles.summary: Senate Democrats are grilling CFTC Chair Rostin Behnam about his agency's oversight of prediction markets, likely focusing on recent approvals for political betting platforms. The pressure signals growing Democratic concern that prediction markets could influence elections, which means tighter regulations and approval delays are coming.

articles.title: What Will Trump Say Next? Prediction-Market Traders Are Betting on It
articles.summary: Prediction market traders are now betting on specific statements and announcements Trump will make, turning presidential rhetoric into a tradable asset. This creates a new category of high-frequency political markets where traders can profit from parsing Trump's communication patterns and timing rather than waiting for election outcomes.

articles.title: Pre­diction markets offer real-time insight into possible primary election outcomes
articles.summary: Prediction markets are tracking primary races in real-time, giving bettors and political observers live odds on who's likely to win before traditional polls catch up. This creates arbitrage opportunities for sharp bettors who can spot momentum shifts faster than the mainstream media and capitalize on mispriced candidates before the markets correct.

articles.title: What will Trump say during the State of the Union? Here’s what prediction markets think.
articles.summary: Prediction markets are pricing the odds on specific topics, phrases, and policy announcements Trump might include in his upcoming State of the Union address. These bets offer early signals on which campaign promises he'll prioritize and how he'll frame his agenda, giving traders a way to profit from political theater while revealing crowd wisdom about presidential messaging strategy.

articles.title: Polymarket for restaurants: Let’s predict when SF’s most overhyped eateries will open
articles.summary: San Francisco's restaurant scene is notorious for ambitious openings that drag on for months or years past their promised launch dates, making them perfect candidates for prediction market betting. A Polymarket-style platform for restaurant openings would let bettors capitalize on insider knowledge about permits, construction delays, and chef drama while providing real price discovery on when these overhyped spots will actually serve food.

articles.title: Feds challenge state authority in prediction markets turf war
articles.summary: Federal regulators are pushing back against states trying to regulate prediction markets within their borders, creating a jurisdictional showdown over who gets to call the shots. The outcome will determine whether prediction markets face a patchwork of conflicting state rules or get clearer federal oversight that could either legitimize the industry or crush it entirely.

articles.title: Buzz of the Week: How should Utah handle online sports betting through ‘prediction markets’?
articles.summary: Utah legislators are debating whether to allow online sports betting by classifying it as "prediction markets" rather than traditional gambling. This semantic sleight of hand could open the floodgates for sports betting in one of America's most restrictive gambling states while potentially legitimizing prediction markets as a workaround for anti-gambling laws nationwide.

articles.title: Protracted legal fight expected in Nevada v. Kalshi
articles.summary: Nevada is gearing up for a lengthy legal battle against prediction market platform Kalshi, likely over regulatory jurisdiction or compliance issues. The outcome will set crucial precedent for how states can regulate prediction markets operating within their borders, potentially reshaping the entire industry's legal landscape.

articles.title: Clarity Act Crypto 2026 Odds Crash as Tariffs Rattle Markets
articles.summary: Prediction markets are pricing in a sharp drop in chances that crypto-friendly legislation passes by 2026, as new tariff announcements spook traders across all risk assets. The crypto regulation timeline just became a key bellwether for broader market sentiment, giving bettors a cleaner read on whether Washington will prioritize economic stability over regulatory clarity.
